basics.name: Mario Daniel Ruiz Saavedra
basics.label: Developer
basics.summary: Mario is a Colombian Developer with a love for Free Software, Free Culture, and all things GNU. Mostly a Java dev, but no fear against C#, C++ or Javascript. Vala user.

work.summary: Accendo is a software development workshop with a focus on RFID and product tracking.
highlights: Built TerraInnova: An e-commerce and contact portal, specialized in agricultural commodities and keeping producers and consumers in touch. The development included a backend written in Java, using Spring MVC, jOOQ, PostgreSQL, and a frontend with Thymeleaf, Bootstrap and jQuery. The portal runs on CentOS 7, with AWS for the user data layer.

Collaborated building WColombia: A web tool for inventory management and income/expense tracking of slot machines, taking into account taxes and goverment regulations. I worked  on the backend side, with Java 8,  Spring Framework MVC, JPA, Hibernate, jOOQ and PostgreSQL.

Collaborated building Crisálida. Crisálida is a government program to educate about  sexual relationships, coexistence and child’s rights. Our portal managed surveys, student inscriptions, situational alarms, and report bulding (as a .xls file). The 		backend uses Spring Data, Spring MVC, Spring Boot, jOOQ, and PostgreSQL. Frontend-wise, it uses Javascript (JSX) with React, Redux in the data layer, and a Bootstrap 3 based design.

Sushi2Home : Built a employee-facing frontend with C# and WPF, to handle incoming orders, automatic receipt printing, and delivery assignment; and collaborated in the consumer-facing portal, where I helped with the auto-combo generation. Sushi2Home is a sushi delivery service, available vía social media and its own website. It consists of a server in Ruby-on-Rails, with PostgreSQL and a customized instance of an e-comerce platform, Shoppe.

Trackvy is a RFID-based stock management system. I worked on a port of the C# Windows CE Reader client to a new API version; a new readings portal for tool lending in C#, Windows Forms, and SQLite; a new version of the tagging and movement desktop tool in Java 8, JavaFX, H2, and Spring Context; and a port of the frontend from Angular 1 + Typescript+ D3.js to HTML5, jQuery, Chartist.js, Bootstrap and Thymeleaf.

work.summary: Nativapps is a nearshore IT partner and development shop with a focus on educational projects
highlights: Built the backend for OpenMDM. OpenMDM is a mobile device management platform. It can track a device’s location, battery info, and connection status. It also includes a remote management module vía web browser, and a command execution system. The backend was built with Java 8, Spring Framework, jOOQ, ActiveMQ, and Swagger for the API documentation

Analítico  is a reporting tool created to help people on the medical industry on the United States to visualize the data related to providers, patients and claims in a readable and interactive presentation. I'm currently involved with the Data importing and DB modelling in MongoDB.
